## Readings

There's no perfect textbook for data science, so readings will come from a variety of sources including:

-   [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/)
-   [Introduction to Data Science](https://ubc-dsci.github.io/introduction-to-datascience/)
-   [Introduction to Data Science](https://rafalab.github.io/dsbook/)
-   [Fundamentals of Data Visualization](https://serialmentor.com/dataviz/)
-   [An Introduction to Statistical Learning](http://faculty.marshall.usc.edu/gareth-james/ISL/)

## R guides

RStudio has created some excellent cheat sheets that I often have on my desk

- [RStudio IDE](https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/rstudio-ide.pdf)
- [dynamic documents with rmarkdown](https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/rmarkdown.pdf)
- [data visualization with ggplot2](https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/data-visualization.pdf)
- [data transformations with dplyr](https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/data-transformation.pdf)
- [data tidying with tidyr](https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/tidyr.pdf)
- [data import with readr, readxl, and googlesheets4](https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/data-import.pdf)
- [apply functions with purrr](https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/purrr.pdf)
- [stringr manipulation with stringr](https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/strings.pdf)
- [factors with forcats](https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/factors.pdf)
- [dates and time with lubridate](https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/lubridate.pdf)
- [interactive web apps with shiny](https://github.com/rstudio/cheatsheets/raw/master/shiny.pdf)
